metadata.Title: CVE-2021-39144 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: XStream is a simple library to serialize objects to XML and back again. In affected versions this vulnerability may allow a remote attacker has sufficient rights to execute commands of the host only by manipulating the processed input stream. No user is affected, who followed the recommendation to setup XStream's security framework with a whitelist limited to the minimal required types. XStream 1.4.18 uses no longer a blacklist by default, since it cannot be secured for general purpose.

notes.Note: sahnaseredini> for `trusty` and `xenial`, the code is not present and the available pocs cannot be exploited

criterions.comment: libxstream-java: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
